title: 109_s4032
content: The "Iran Nuclear Nonproliferation Act of 2006" prohibits the US from cooperating with countries assisting Iran's nuclear program or transferring weapons to Iran without specific presidential determinations. The "Iran Nuclear Nonproliferation Act of 2006" prohibits agreements for cooperation with countries assisting Iran's nuclear program or transferring weapons to Iran without specific presidential determinations. No such agreements can be submitted to the President or Congress, no licenses for export to these countries can be issued, and no approvals for transfer of nuclear material or technology can be given until the President determines and reports. The "Iran Nuclear Nonproliferation Act of 2006" prohibits agreements for cooperation with countries assisting Iran's nuclear program or transferring weapons to Iran without specific presidential determinations. Iran must suspend all enrichment-related activities and commit to refraining from such activities in the future, subject to strict international safeguards. The "Iran Nuclear Nonproliferation Act of 2006" requires countries to suspend nuclear assistance and transfers of weapons to Iran until Iran implements measures allowing the President to make a determination. These restrictions apply in addition to other procedures and requirements. The Atomic Energy Act of 1954 and other laws contain procedures, requirements, and restrictions. The Act does not affect the validity of cooperation agreements in effect. SEC. 4. DEFINITIONS. In this Act, "agreement for cooperation" is defined as per the Atomic Energy Act of 1954. "Assisting the nuclear program of Iran" refers to the intentional transfer of goods, services, or technology to Iran as outlined in specific guidelines. The term "country that is assisting the nuclear program of Iran or transferring advanced conventional weapons or missiles to Iran" includes Russia and any other country determined by the President to be assisting Iran's nuclear program or transferring weapons. The term "transferring advanced conventional weapons or missiles to Iran" refers to the intentional transfer of goods, services, or technology to Iran listed on specific control regimes.
